artist: Artist: Jessica Stockholder; Publisher: Two Palms Press, New York
classification: Prints; Collages / Assemblages; Works on Paper
creditline: Gift of Harris Schrank in celebration of the 100th anniversary of the Minneapolis Institute of Arts
description: Abstract design with white organic form at center and top; three dark purple and one pink leaf-like motifs at right; turquoise form in velvet at LLQ and bottom center; yellow silk ground
inscription: on back, in pencil: TWO PALMS PRESS
medium: Relief print with embossment, wood engraving, fake fur, yellow Lake Como silk, and upholstery
provenance: [International Print Center New York (publisher); sold to Schrank]; [Harris Schrank, New York]; given to MIA, 2014.
signed: on back, in pencil: J. Stockholder 2001
text: Brilliant, high-key color, textured surfaces, and the spatial and formal relationship of forms are crucial components of Jessica Stockholder's work. Her fascination with color, assemblage, and spatial interactions is apparent in this mixed media print, a lively intersection of layered geometric shapes and white plant-like forms. Fake yellow fur and swatches of cloth add to the work’s unusual and ambiguous formal and material characteristics.
title: Untitled IPCNY
